soc.util

Class I18n

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.util.I18n

  • public abstract class I18n
extends java.lang.Object
    Common helper functions for internationalization and localization (I18N).

    I18N localization was added in v2.0.00; network messages sending localized text should check the remote receiver's version against SOCStringManager.VERSION_FOR_I18N.

    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>
    See Also:
    SOCStringManager

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      static java.lang.String PROP_JSETTLERS_LOCALE
      Optional JVM property jsettlers.locale to specify the locale, overriding the default from Locale.getDefault().

    • Method Detail

      • listItems

        public static java.lang.String listItems(java.util.List<?> items,
                                         SOCStringManager strings)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Build a string with the contents of this list, such as "x, y, and z".

        This method and its formatting strings (i18n.listitems.*) may need refinement as more languages are supported.

        Parameters:
        items - Each item's toString() will be placed in the list
        strings - StringManager to retrieve localized formatting between items
        Returns:
        A string nicely listing the items, with a form such as:
        • nothing
        • x
        • x and y
        • x, y, and z
        • x, y, z, and w
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if items is null, or strings is null

      • bytesToHumanUnits

        public static java.lang.String bytesToHumanUnits(long bytes)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        For display, return bytes in "human-readable" units: MB or GB, to 3 significant figures (23.7 MB, 123 MB, 2.10 GB). This method uses binary kilobytes of 1024, not decimal 1000.

        Because it currently has one specific use, it doesn't work with KB or TB or the user's locale, but always reports as MB or GB. Later versions can expand that if needed.

        Parameters:
        bytes - Number of bytes to transform into "human-readable" units; non-negative
        Returns:
        String with a number of MB or GB, with at least 2 decimal digits
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bytes < 0
        Since:
        2.3.00

      • durationToDaysHoursMinutesSeconds

        public static java.lang.String durationToDaysHoursMinutesSeconds(long millis,
                                                                 SOCStringManager strings)
                                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Localize a duration as either hours:minutes:seconds, leading with days if needed.
        Parameters:
        millis - Duration in milliseconds
        strings - StringManager to retrieve localized formatting
        Returns:
        localized equivalent of duration, like "1:03:52" or "2 days 1:03:52"
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if millis < 0
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if strings is null
        Since:
        2.3.00
